Smith Stadium | StadCapacity =22,000 | StadSurface =[[FieldTurf]] | Location =[[Bowling Green, Kentucky]] | ConferenceDisplay=Sun Belt | ConferenceLink =Sun Belt Conference | ConfDivision = | FirstYear =1908 | AthlDirectorDisp = | AthlDirectorLink = | WebsiteName =Western Kentucky Official Athletic Site | WebsiteURL =http://www.wkusports.com/ | ATWins =511 | ATLosses =349 | ATTies =30 | ATPercentage = | BowlWins =2 | BowlLosses =0 | BowlTies =0 | NatlTitles =1 ([[Football Championship Subdivision|FCS]]) | ConfTitles =11 (6 [[NCAA Division II|Division II]], 4 [[Football Championship Subdivision|FCS]], 1 [[Football Bowl Subdivision|FBS]]) | Heismans =0 | AllAmericans =5 | uniform = | Color1 =Red | Color1Hex =FF2222 | Color2 =White | Color2Hex =FFFFFF | FightSong =[[Stand Up and Cheer (song)|Stand Up and Cheer!]] | MascotDisplay =[[Big Red (Western Kentucky University)|Big Red]] | MarchingBand =[[Big Red Marching Band]] | PagFreeLabel =Rival | PagFreeValue =[[Middle Tennessee State Blue Raiders football|Middle Tennessee State]] }} The '''[[Western Kentucky University|Western Kentucky]] [[Western Kentucky Hilltoppers|Hilltoppers]] [[American football|football]]''' program is a [[college football]] team that represents [[Western Kentucky University]]. The team is currently a member of the [[Sun Belt Conference]], which is a [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] Bowl Subdivision (formerly Division I-A) member of the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] (NCAA). The program has 1 national championship ([[Football Championship Subdivision|FCS]]), 11 conference championships (1 [[Southern Intercollegiate Athletic Association|SIAA]], 9 [[Ohio Valley Conference|OVC]] and 1 [[Gateway Football Conference|Gateway]]) and 5 Consensus [[All-America]]ns. The team is currently coached by [[Willie Taggart]] and play their home games at [[Houchens Industries â L. T. Smith Stadium]] in [[Bowling Green, Kentucky]]. ==Recent history== In 2007, led by head coach [[David Elson]], Western Kentucky's football program began the transition from the [[Football Championship Subdivision]] to the [[Football Bowl Subdivision]]. As part of the transition, they played defending national champion [[2007 Florida Gators football team|Florida]]. {{main|2008 Western Kentucky Hilltoppers football team}} In 2008, Western Kentucky began play as a Division I FBS football team. Although they were ineligble for a bowl game, they played in a newly expanded [[L.T. Smith Stadium]]. Teams played included #11 Alabama, #20 Virginia Tech, #25 Ball State, Indiana and Kentucky. {{main|2009 Western Kentucky Hilltoppers football team}} In 2009, Western Kentucky began play as a new, full FBS member and a new member of the Sun Belt Conference. In non-conference play, the team faced BCS programs Tennessee and South Florida. {{main|2010 Western Kentucky Hilltoppers football team}} In 2010, the Hilltoppers will be led by new head coach [[Willie Taggart]], who comes off coaching [[Toby Gerhart]] as RB coach at Stanford. ==NCAA affiliations== 1910-1937: Member
